timeline.title: First Connection
timeline.description: The first internet connection was established at the Universidad del Valle de Guatemala, marking the beginning of internet use in the country.

timeline.title: First ISP
timeline.description: The first commercial internet service provider (ISP), Tigo, was launched, expanding internet access to the public.

timeline.title: Internet for All
timeline.description: The government introduced the 'Internet for All' program to bring internet access to rural areas.

timeline.title: Broadband Growth
timeline.description: Broadband internet services became more available in urban areas, improving speed and affordability.

timeline.title: Mobile Internet
timeline.description: Mobile internet usage grew as mobile phones became affordable and data packages were introduced.

timeline.title: Public Wi-Fi
timeline.description: Guatemala City began offering free public Wi-Fi in key areas like parks and government buildings.

timeline.title: Digital Agenda
timeline.description: The 'Digital Agenda for Guatemala' was launched, focusing on infrastructure, digital literacy, and e-commerce.

timeline.title: Pandemic Acceleration
timeline.description: The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated internet adoption for education, business, and government services.

timeline.title: Broadband Plan
timeline.description: The government launched a national broadband plan to improve internet access, especially in remote regions.

timeline.title: 5G Push
timeline.description: Guatemala began exploring 5G technology to enhance internet connectivity, including for agriculture.
